roleset.name: build, creation
roleset.note: ASSEMBLE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'assemble' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet class build-26.1. (from assemble.01-v)
ASSEMBLY-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry assemble.01, OntoNotes grouping assembly-n sense 3; maps to VN class build-26.1. Framed by Claire. (from assembly.01-n)

roles.note: Might be hard to get both start and end state in a single example.But who knows? (from assemble.01-v) Don't really know why end state is arg4, but it's like this with other "build" verbs so... (from assembly.01-n)

example.name: basic frame, no start/end states
example.text: [The Dearborn, Mich., auto maker]-1 ran a loss of $37 million on *trace*-1 assembling and marketing cars in the U.S.

example.name: with start state
example.text: John assembles miniature ships out of toothpicks.

example.name: Arg 1 only
example.text: The assembly of the new bicycle took all day.

example.name: Args 0, 1, 4
example.text: John's assembly of a pink huffy from a kit into a mountain-biking machine shocked Mary.

roleset.name: group, grouping together
roleset.note: ASSEMBLE-V NOTES: VerbNet class herd-47.5.2. (from assemble.02-v)
ASSEMBLY-N NOTES: Roleset based on assemble.02, OntoNotes grouping assembly-n sense 2; maps to VN class herd-47.5.2. Framed by Claire. (from assembly.02-n)

roles.note: That could go either way; avoid using Arg2 unless both Arg1 and Arg2are explicit. (from assemble.02-v)

role.descr: theme, thing being included in some group

example.name: no group
example.text: Commodore has assembled an experienced management team.

example.name: both theme and group
example.text: John assembled his dirty socks into a formidable (and smelly) pile.

example.name: Arg 1 & LOC
example.text: We called for the assembly of all disgruntled citizens at the town square.

example.name: Args 1 & 2
example.text: The assembly of the different governing bodies into one major department was his finest achievement as governor.

example.name: All arguments
example.text: It required days to transform his assembly of casual auxiliaries into a semblance of the efficient righting force he had professed to lead.
example.arg: into a semblance of the efficient righting force he had professed to lead.
